title: How to Make Christmas Light Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Line a cupcake tray with 18 paper liners.
Mix the cake mix, pudding mix, and wet ingredients in a large bowl.
steps.description: Beat using an electric mixer and blend until well-combined.

steps.headline: Scoop the batter onto each liner on the cupcake tray.
Place the tray in the oven and allow the cupcakes to bake for about 18-20 minutes.
Allow the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
Pipe vanilla buttercream frosting onto each cupcake.
Swirl around the black frosting each cupcake using a frosting pipe with a round tip.
steps.description: This will resemble the 'wires' on the lights.

steps.headline: Poke M&Ms into each cupcake vertically (not flat) so that a 'half moon' of each M&M sticks out.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the cupcakes on a large serving plate and serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Line a cupcake tray with 18 paper liners.  Mix the cake mix, pudding mix, and wet ingredients in a large bowl. Beat using an electric mixer and blend until well-combined. Scoop the batter onto each liner on the cupcake tray.  Place the tray in the oven and allow the cupcakes to bake for about 18-20 minutes.  Allow the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.  Pipe vanilla buttercream frosting onto each cupcake.  Swirl around the black frosting each cupcake using a frosting pipe with a round tip. This will resemble the 'wires' on the lights. Poke M&Ms into each cupcake vertically (not flat) so that a 'half moon' of each M&M sticks out. These will resemble the 'Christmas-themed lights'. Serve. Place the cupcakes on a large serving plate and serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!
